result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Cases 20CF1033, 22CF241 are called at 3:19 PM) Defendant Jason C. Walker appeared in court, Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard for Jason C. Walker appeared in court, Attorney Robert W. Stoiber for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
20CF1033- Defense indicates that there is no agreement. Jury Trial to proceed. Discussion held regarding trial procedures. 
Court orders 1 alternate juror, Jury instructions to be filed by 04/15/2022, Witness Lists to be filed in advance of trial (no specific date given), Motions in Limine can be dealt with the day of trial. Pre-Trial Conference to begin at 8:30 AM and Jury selection to begin at 9:00 AM.  
22CF241- Defense waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
This case to ride along with 20CF1033.
